description: From Old French simonie, from Late Latin simonia, named after Simon Magus (Hebrew שִׁמְעוֹן‎ (Šimʻôn, “Simon”)), with reference to Acts 8:18–20.

entries.meaning: The buying or selling of spiritual or sacred things, such as ecclesiastical offices, pardons, or consecrated objects.
examples: ‘There are those two,’ he then said, ‘who were recently arraigned on a charge of high simony. Fancying a monstrance and stealing it and proposing to sell it. They pleaded the usual pagan ignorance.’
